pullRequest.body:
The definition of `parallelProd` used `Kernel.prod`, which uses `compProd`. In order to untangle those definitions (and perhaps redefine `compProd` from `comp` and `parallelProd` in the future) this PR replaces the definition of `parallelProd` by a direct definition.

A few lemmas that are about the interaction of parallelProd and other composition or product operations are moved to the Lemmas file to reduce imports.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [904506b457](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22428/commits/904506b4577367956983c6041cfa152a5c06bcfb)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.ParallelComp | 1450 | 1446 | -4 (-0.28%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.ParallelComp`|-4|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_zero_of_isEmpty_left`
`+ eq_zero_of_isEmpty_right`
`+ instance : IsSFiniteKernel (κ ∥ₖ η) := by`
`+ instance [IsFiniteKernel κ] [IsFiniteKernel η] : IsFiniteKernel (κ ∥ₖ η) := by`
`+ instance [IsMarkovKernel κ] [IsMarkovKernel η] : IsMarkovKernel (κ ∥ₖ η)`
`+ instance [IsZeroOrMarkovKernel κ] [IsZeroOrMarkovKernel η] : IsZeroOrMarkovKernel (κ ∥ₖ η) := by`
`+ isSFiniteKernel_prodMkLeft_iff`
`+ isSFiniteKernel_prodMkRight_iff`
`+ lintegral_parallelComp_symm`
`+ parallelComp_apply'`
`+ parallelComp_apply_univ`
`+ parallelComp_of_not_isSFiniteKernel_left`
`+ parallelComp_of_not_isSFiniteKernel_right`
`+ parallelComp_sum_left`
`+ parallelComp_sum_right`
`+ parallelComp_zero_left`
`+ parallelComp_zero_right`
`+ prod_of_not_isSFiniteKernel_left`
`+ prod_of_not_isSFiniteKernel_right`
`+ prod_zero`
`+ swapLeft_zero`
`+ swapRight_zero`
`+ zero_prod`
`- instance (κ : Kernel α β) (η : Kernel γ δ) : IsSFiniteKernel (κ ∥ₖ η) := by`
`- instance (κ : Kernel α β) [IsFiniteKernel κ] (η : Kernel γ δ) [IsFiniteKernel η] :`
`- instance (κ : Kernel α β) [IsMarkovKernel κ] (η : Kernel γ δ) [IsMarkovKernel η] :`
`- instance (κ : Kernel α β) [IsZeroOrMarkovKernel κ] (η : Kernel γ δ) [IsZeroOrMarkovKernel η] :`
`- parallelComp`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I removed some s-finite assumptions, but since our kernel API is full of holes, that meant adding quite a few simp lemmas.

You can also do:
```suggestion
  rw [parallelComp, dif_neg (not_and_of_not_left _ h)]
```
As you prefer. Same below

You can also do:
```suggestion
  rw [parallelComp, dif_pos ⟨inferInstance, inferInstance⟩, coe_mk]
```
I tend to think that `rfl` after a rewrite is a bit ugly, but it's up to you.

My opinion is that any lemma I have to spell out in a `rw` chain (and for which I therefore have to know or find a name) is a failure of proof automation.
But my even stronger opinion is also that I don't care enough about the details of the proofs to have a real preference here, hence I'll merge all suggestions similar to that one :) .

Related remark: the probability transition kernel library is really bad with respect to automation, and `rw` chains are everywhere. If we identified clear normal forms for kernels and put automation in place (which might be as simple as `simp` attributes) we should be able to improve the situation.

Indeed I agree that lots of proofs about kernels are just unfolding definitions and proving measurability. The issue with `simp` attributes is that it won't apply if the measurability condition is not met, so I think we would need a tactic which automatically creates the subgoals (and I have no idea how metaprogramming works in lean).
You can remove the s-finiteness assumption because it is zero in this case.
Won't both sides be zero if one of the kernels is s-finite?

You can do this:
```suggestion
  simp_rw [Prod.swap_prod_mk, Measure.dirac_apply' _ hs, ← Set.indicator_comp_right,
    lintegral_indicator (measurable_prod_mk_left hs)]
  simp
```

You can drop the namespace:
```suggestion
lemma deterministic_comp_copy {f : α → β} (hf : Measurable f) :
    (deterministic f hf ∥ₖ deterministic f hf) ∘ₖ copy α = copy β ∘ₖ deterministic f hf := by
  simp_rw [parallelComp_comp_copy, deterministic_prod_deterministic, copy,
    deterministic_comp_deterministic, Function.comp_def]
```
should this be an `irreducible_def` now that it's an `if` (which means we will almost never use the definition, only its API)?

Thank you for adding all these new lemmas!
```suggestion
    simpa [swapLeft_prodMkLeft, isSFiniteKernel_prodMkRight_iff]
```

pullRequest.title: chore(Probability/Kernel): make `parallelProd` independent of `compProd`
